importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the most recent update to the news of the Los Angeles Dodgers' National League Championship Series victory and Shohei Ohtani's historic performance.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe in which the 2025 postseason and the World Series are taking place, marking a key moment in the current baseball season.

keyTakeAways: Shohei Ohtani delivered a legendary performance in Game 4 of the National League Championship Series, hitting three home runs, striking out 10 batters, and pitching six innings in a shutout.

Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to hit three home runs and strike out at least 10 batters in the same game, and the first starting pitcher since 1900 to hit multiple home runs in a postseason game.
This performance marked the first time a starting pitcher has pitched in 13 consecutive days, highlighting Ohtani's physical endurance and dominance.
The Los Angeles Dodgers swept the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS, securing their spot in the World Series for the first time since 2024, and are now the top contenders after a perfect postseason run.
The Dodgers' pitching staff, featuring Ohtani, Blake Snell, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, Tyler Glasnow, and others, has been dominant, allowing fewer than one run per game since a prior playoff loss.
Shohei Ohtani was named National League Championship Series MVP, acknowledging his unprecedented performance and impact on the game.
This marks the fifth time in the last nine seasons that the Dodgers have won the National League pennant and the 26th appearance in the World Series in franchise history.

The Dodgers are the first team to return to the World Series the year after winning it since the Philadelphia Phillies in the late 2000s, and no team has repeated as World Series champions since the 1998–2000 Yankees dynasty.
Ohtani's performance has been described as 'the Shohei Ohtani Game,' a moment that will be remembered for its rarity and magnitude in baseball history.
The Dodgers' success has led to widespread admiration from teammates, including Clayton Kershaw, who praised Ohtani's unique and otherworldly skill.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Japanese professional baseball player, two-way star (pitcher and hitter), known for his extraordinary performance in the 2025 NLCS.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani’s record-breaking performance in the NLCS—hitting three home runs, striking out 10 batters, and pitching a shutout—made him the centerpiece of the article and a symbol of modern baseball excellence and uniqueness.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team based in Los Angeles, competing in Major League Baseball (MLB).
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the team that achieved a four-game sweep of the Milwaukee Brewers, clinching the NLCS and advancing to the World Series, marking a significant milestone in their recent postseason history.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team based in Milwaukee, competing in Major League Baseball (MLB).
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were defeated by the Dodgers in a four-game sweep in the National League Championship Series, making them the NLCS opponents in this article.

namedEntities.name: National League Championship Series (NLCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The postseason series in Major League Baseball determining the National League representative for the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This series is the context in which Shohei Ohtani’s historic performance occurred, and the Dodgers' victory in this series earned them a spot in the World Series.

namedEntities.name: World Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The championship series in Major League Baseball between the National League and American League champions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers’ success in the NLCS qualified them for the World Series, where they will face the American League champion, marking the culmination of their postseason run.

namedEntities.name: Clayton Kershaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher, a Hall of Fame-caliber player and current postseason participant.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kershaw praised Ohtani’s performance, emphasizing the uniqueness of Ohtani’s abilities and the team’s dynamic chemistry, adding to the article’s narrative about team excellence.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Los Angeles Dodgers first baseman and key offensive contributor.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman expressed awe at Ohtani’s performance, highlighting the team effort and the historic nature of the game, reinforcing the narrative of collective achievement.

namedEntities.name: Blake Snell
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher, part of the team's playoff rotation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Snell is part of the Dodgers’ strong pitching rotation that has kept the team competitive throughout the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Yoshinobu Yamamoto
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher, part of the team's playoff rotation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Yamamoto is part of the Dodgers’ pitching staff that has proven dominant in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Tyler Glasnow
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher, part of the team's playoff rotation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Glasnow contributes to the Dodgers’ formidable pitching staff, which has kept the team’s run totals low in the playoffs.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team based in Seattle, competing in Major League Baseball (MLB).
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are mentioned as being ahead in the American League Championship Series against the Toronto Blue Jays, indicating the upcoming opponent for the Dodgers in the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team based in Toronto, competing in Major League Baseball (MLB).
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the current opponents of the Seattle Mariners in the American League Championship Series, thus setting up the potential World Series matchup against the Dodgers.

namedEntities.name: David Roberts
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Manager Dave Roberts made a public statement about the team's success and the idea of 'ruining baseball,' linking the Dodgers’ performance to broader cultural impact in the sport.

namedEntities.name: MLB Statistician Sarah Langs
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: MLB statistician who analyzed Shohei Ohtani’s performance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Langs confirmed historical milestones in Ohtani’s performance, providing statistical validation for the article’s claims about unprecedented achievements.

namedEntities.name: TNT Sports
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: TNT Sports broadcasted the game and reported on Ohtani’s performance, including historical milestones in postseason pitching and hitting.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Shohei Ohtani delivered an unprecedented performance in Game 4 of the National League Championship Series, hitting three home runs, striking out 10 batters, and pitching a six-inning shutout—making him the first player in MLB history to hit three home runs and strike out 10+ batters in a single game, and the first starting pitcher since 1900 to hit multiple home runs in a postseason game. The Los Angeles Dodgers swept the Milwaukee Brewers in four games, earning their spot in the World Series. Ohtani was named NLCS MVP, and his performance has been hailed as 'the Shohei Ohtani Game,' a landmark moment in baseball history. The Dodgers, already a dominant force in recent postseason runs, now face an American League champion in the World Series, with their powerful rotation and team chemistry making them one of the most formidable teams in MLB history.
title: Shohei Ohtani’s Legendary Night Leads Los Angeles Dodgers to Another World Series, Sweeping Milwaukee in 4 Games
